title: Ticket #187: Analyze use of old classads in Condor
description:
We need to go through the code base and create what essentially amounts to a histogram of old classad methods in use. For example, if old classads have 100 public methods, how many of those are actually being used in the code? Do XXX number of methods represent 90% of all the call sites?

Once we have an understanding of old classads are used, we need to create a document. For each old classad method in use, working in order of most usage to least usage, we should map the old method to a corresponding new classad method(s). In addition, for each mapping, we need to note any semantic differences between the old function and the new function. For example, perhaps there is an Insert() method in old ads and an Insert() method in new ads - items to note re semantic differences could include:

  • semantic impact in the library; maybe the old Insert() is really an insert or replace, while the new Insert() will return an error if the attribute already exists.
  • memory management; who is responsible for allocating/freeing memory?
  • return values and error handling

Initially, Jaime will lead this effort and will have Varghese and Nick providing much of the manpower.
remarks:
2009-Feb-05 16:16:54 by jfrey:
Today, Varghese and I met briefly to talk about his first task (collecting data on frequency of method calls to old classads). He's starting to look at the code.

Tomorrow morning, we'll meet with Nick to further brainstorm how to collect the data and set up timeline of tasks.

2009-Feb-06 14:11:12 by jfrey:
Nick, Varghese and I met today. Varghese will try using Cscope to collect the call site data for old ClassAds. Nick will try CodeViz. We'll meet again Monday morning to look at the results and plan further steps.

2009-Feb-11 14:38:18 by jfrey:
Nick and Varghese used separate methods to count the number of invocations of old classad methods in Condor. Their counts roughly agreed with each other. There is now a wiki page listing all of the methods and counts. We will go through and estimate the cost to convert call sites or emulate the functions.

2009-Feb-12 12:57:15 by tannenba:
Much data about old ClassAd usage is being created here.

2009-Apr-05 21:33:59 by matt:
Did you see this?

http://condor-wiki.cs.wisc.edu/index.cgi/fileview?f=src/condor_classad.V6/deprecated.txt&v=f634884c7df803c568a5c702e22f018e12b25b66

2009-Apr-06 16:48:27 by jfrey:
Yes, I looked at that file after we started examining the old ClassAd methods. While a useful starting-point, the file has fallen out-of-date as new methods were added and existing ones acquired new functionality.

2009-Nov-17 11:37:45 by jfrey:
We have a good understanding of how and where old ClassAds are used and how to transition to new ClassAds. I'm going to resolved this ticket.
